tit.e: Tenka San Nasu (three eggplant-shaped tea caddies)
Tenka San Nasu (three eggplant-shaped tea caddies)

sen.j: 天下三茄子（てんかさんなす）とは、九十九髪茄子、松本茄子、富士茄子の三つのことである。
sen.e: "Tenka San Nasu" refers to the following three Nasu (eggplant-shaped tea caddies): Tsukumo Nasu, Matsumoto Nasu, and Fuji Nasu.
sen.cmt: 用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: Tenka San Nasu refers to the following three Nasu (eggplant-shaped tea caddy): Tsukumo Nasu (literally, Nasu of gray hair), Matsumoto Nasu (Nasu originally owned by Shuho MATSUMOTO), and Fuji Nasu (literally, Nasu of Mt. Fuji).

Tenka San Nasu refers to the following three Nasu (eggplant-shaped tea caddy): Tsukumo Nasu (literally, Nasu of gray hair), Matsumoto Nasu (Nasu originally owned by Shuho MATSUMOTO), and Fuji Nasu (literally, Nasu of Mt. Fuji).

sen.j: 上の三つは優れた名物として、有名である。
sen.e: The above thee are famous for being excellent Meibutsu (utensils for Cha no yu, or the tea ceremony, that are of great historic and artistic values).
sen.cmt: 用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: The above three are famous for being excellent Meibutsu (utensils for Cha no yu, or the tea ceremony, that are of great historic and artistic values).
The above three are famous for being excellent Meibutsu (utensils for Cha no yu, or the tea ceremony, that are of great historic and artistic values).

sen.j: この茄子とは、丸形のやや膨れ口造りと細くなっている茶入。
sen.e: The term "Nasu" refers to a round Chaire (tea caddy) with a slightly thin and raised mouth.
sen.cmt: 用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: This Nasu refers to a round Chaire (tea caddy) with a slightly thin and raised mouth.
This Nasu refers to a round Chaire (tea caddy) with a slightly thin and raised mouth.

sen.j: 全体の形がナス（なす）に似ているのでこのような名前がついた。
sen.e: It is named as such because the general shape of it resembles Nasu (an eggplant).
It is named as such because the general shape of it resembles Nasu (an eggplant).
It is named as such because the general shape of it resembles Nasu (an eggplant).

sen.j: さらに茄子は唐物入れの最上位についている。
sen.e: Furthermore, it ranks the top of Karamono-ire (tea caddies imported from China).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: Furthermore, it ranks the top of Karamono-ire (tea caddy imported from China).
Furthermore, it ranks the top of Karamono-ire (tea caddy imported from China).

sen.j: 茄子は天下、肩衝は征夷大将軍と言われる。
sen.e: It is called Tenka (Emperor) and Katatsuki (a square-shouldered tea caddy) is referred to as Sei Taishogun (literally, "the great general who subdues the barbarians," but here semantically Shogun).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is called Tenka (Emperor) and Katatsuki (a square-shouldered tea caddy) is referred to as Seii Taishogun (literally, "the great general who subdues the barbarians," but here semantically Shogun).
It is called Tenka (Emperor) and Katatsuki (a square-shouldered tea caddy) is referred to as Seii Taishogun (literally, "the great general who subdues the barbarians," but here semantically Shogun).

sen.j: 宝珠の形に近いことから、茄子茶入はすべての茶入に先立つとも言われる。
sen.e: Nasu Chaire is also said to precede every other Chaire because it is similar in shape to Hoju (a wish-fulfilling gem shaped like a large droplet).
sen.cmt: 用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: Nasu Chaire is also said to precede every other Chaire because it is similar in shape to Hoju (a wish-fulfilling gem shaped like a large droplet).
Nasu Chaire is also said to precede every other Chaire because it is similar in shape to Hoju (a wish-fulfilling gem shaped like a large droplet).

sen.j: また、利休以前は真の盆点には茄子の茶入以外は用いなかったとされる。
sen.e: Additionally, it is reported that no Chaire other than Nasu was used in the real Bondate (one of the ritualized forms of making and serving tea, specifically in relation to the handling of Chaire on a tea tray, in Cha no yu) before Rikyu.
sen.cmt: 用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: Additionally, it is reported that no Chaire other than Nasu was used in the real Bondate (one of the ritualized forms of making and serving tea, specifically in relation to the handling of Chaire on a tea tray, in Cha no yu) before Rikyu.

Additionally, it is reported that no Chaire other than Nasu was used in the real Bondate (one of the ritualized forms of making and serving tea, specifically in relation to the handling of Chaire on a tea tray, in Cha no yu) before Rikyu.
Meibutsu Itsutsu Nasu (Meibutsu five Nasu)
Meibutsu Itsutsu Nasu (Meibutsu five Nasu)
Meibutsu Itsutsu Nasu (Meibutsu five Nasu)

sen.j: 上と同様に、優れた茄子に名物五つ茄子と言われ優れた茄子が存在する。
sen.e: Just as above, excellent Meibutsu Itsutsu Nasu are found among fine Nasu.
Just as above, excellent Meibutsu Itsutsu Nasu are found among fine Nasu.
Just as above, excellent Meibutsu Itsutsu Nasu are found among fine Nasu.
Fuji Nasu.
Fuji Nasu.
Fuji Nasu.
Akebono Nasu.
Akebono Nasu (literally, Nasu of dawn).
Akebono Nasu (literally, Nasu of dawn).
Tanabata Nasu.
Tanabata Nasu (literally, Nasu of Tanabata Festival [Star Festival]).
Tanabata Nasu (literally, Nasu of Tanabata Festival [Star Festival]).
Rikyu Ko-nasu.
Rikyu Ko-nasu (Nasu originally owned by SEN no Rikyu).
Rikyu Ko-nasu (Nasu originally owned by SEN no Rikyu).
Tochigo Nasu.
Bungo Nasu (literally, Nasu of Bungo Province).
sen.cmt: 読み修正、用語補足しました。
sen.e: Bungo Nasu (literally, Nasu of Bungo Province).
